newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Top Hong Kong actor, opera star Tang dies at 81.
newsitem.headline: Top Hong Kong actor, opera star Tang dies at 81.

text.p: Popular Hong Kong opera singer and actor Tang Wing-cheung, better known to his fans as Sun Ma-Chai, has died at the age of 81, his family said on Tuesday.

Tang, whose career spanned seven decades but whose final months were dominated by a family squabble over his fortune, "died peacefully in the presence of his children" on Monday evening his son Tang Siu-chuen told reporters.
His fourth wife and their four children had fought a well-publicised battle over his estate which they say is worth billions of Hong Kong dollars.
The wife, Hung Jin-mui, who he married five years ago after a 30-year affair, was not present when Tang died of chronic bronchitis. Dozens of reporters mobbed the hospital.
Tang also had three children from his third marriage.
Tang began his career as a Cantonese opera performer at the age of nine when poverty forced him to drop out of school and hit stardom only a year later.
He switched to films in the 1950s and made more than 200 films, mostly comedies and musicals.
He retired in the late 1970s but often appeared on the screen to raise money for charities.
